result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam David Solfest was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500) [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent.
Defendant to report to Probation no later than June 8, 2016. 
Bond continues until Defendant reports to Probation.
Defendant is eligible for expungement under 973.015 upon successful completion of Probation.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with:

miscConds.notes:
Joint and Several with Nathan Scholz.
$681.30 restitution to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #16CF31.
$243.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #16CF31.
NO CONTACT whatsoever with Robert W.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment and/or therapy.

records.addlTxt: c: Def, Atty, DA, HPD & E: Probation. eif
signed by Def & Atty this date. eif

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Eric Gordon Johnson, DF ATTY: Barry Curtis Lundeen, DF: Adam David Solfest appeared.  Court called.  Set for STC.  There is an agreement.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the Court.  State moves to amend Ct. 1 to State Disorderly Conduct 947.01.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads Guilty to the amended Ct 1 State Disorderly Contduct (Statute 947.01) & No Contest to Ct. 2.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE the DE adjudicated guilty of the amended Ct 1  & Ct. 2. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:

Ct. 1 & Ct. 2 to run concurrent
W/S 1 year probation with conditions
- The defendant is to have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Robert W.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.
- AODA and follow through with any recommended therapy or treatment
- 20 hours of community service
- Restitution in the amount of $681.30 to be joint and several with Nathan Scholz
- Court costs of $486.00 to be paid through the DOC
- DE to report to probation no later than 06/08/16 
- DE's bond to remain in effect until DE has signed up for probation and then it is vacated
- DE is eligible for expungment under 973.015 after the satisfactory completion of probation
- 20 days to appeal
Status conference on June 6, 2016 at 04:00 pm.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Megan E. Kelly, DF ATTY: Barry Curtis Lundeen, DF: Adam David Solfest appeared.  Court called at 4:11 p.m.  DE has reviewed the Information.  Court informs Def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands.  DE pleads Not Guilty on all counts.  Not Guilty pleas are entered.  Waive speedy trial.  Set out for STC.  Verified the DE's address.  Bail is continued.  Court adjourned.  lw  Status conference scheduled for June 6, 2016 at 04:00 pm.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Megan E. Kelly   DF ATTY: Barry Curtis Lundeen, DF: Adam David Solfest appeared.  Court called at 1:14 p.m.  DE files with the court the Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver.  Court finds that DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives right to a preliminary hearing.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was probably committed and probable cause that the DE probably committed one and binds the DE over for trial.  State files an Information with the Court.  Verified the DE's address.  Bail is continued.  Set out for arraignment.  Court adjourned at 1:16 p.m. lw  Arraignment scheduled for May 10, 2016 at 04:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on April 21, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Prior to leaving the courthouse, report to St Croix County Jail for mugshots and fingerprints.

  It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Robert W.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: EJL, RPR: Val Deiss, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:  Megan E. Kelly,  DF ATTY:  Joel Schlitz for Barry Curtis Lundeen,  DF:  Adam David Solfest appeared. Court confirms address.  Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  Prelim demanded. Waive time limits.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 21, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
